snippet: The insurgents were an alliance of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria and the vestiges of loyalists to the Saddam Hussein government that was ousted by the Americans a decade ago.
abstract: Sunni extremist militants threatening Iraq seize northern city of Tal Afar in battle with Iraqi Army; it is first lethal encounter between Sunni and Shiite combatants since government began mobilizing thousands of Shiites to counter alliance of Islamic State in Iraq and Syria and other Sunni insurgents.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Michael R. Gordon from Washington; Suadad al-Salhy and Aziz Alwan from Baghdad; Tim Arango and  Bryan Denton from Erbil, Iraq; Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran; Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The insurgents were an alliance of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria and the vestiges of loyalists to the Saddam Hussein government that was ousted by the Americans a decade ago.

headline.main: Insurgents in North Ambush Militia Volunteers and Seize Another City
headline.print_headline: Insurgents in North Ambush Militia Volunteers and Seize Another City

keywords.value: Islamic State of Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
